file_insights.description: Created new React component file for pricing UI components
key_elements: PricingCard component - reusable pricing tier card with customizable features
PricingSection component - container component that renders multiple pricing tiers
StyledPricingCard - MUI styled component with featured tier visual differentiation
DEFAULT_PRICING_TIERS - hardcoded pricing data for Starter, Professional, and Enterprise tiers
file_insights.component_structure: Two main exports: PricingCard (single tier) and PricingSection (full section)
file_insights.styling_approach: Material-UI styled components with alpha overlays and theme integration

file_insights.description: Updated barrel export to include new pricing components
file_insights.changes: Added export statement for PricingCard and PricingSection from './PricingSection'

patterns_discovered.description: Used styled component with shouldForwardProp to handle featured boolean prop and apply conditional styling
patterns_discovered.implementation: StyledPricingCard uses featured prop to control transform, shadow, and border styles

patterns_discovered.description: Grid system with responsive breakpoints for pricing cards
patterns_discovered.implementation: xs={12} sm={6} md={4} creates 1-2-3 column layout across breakpoints

patterns_discovered.description: Components accept optional props like featured, description, and onButtonClick with sensible defaults
patterns_discovered.implementation: PricingCardProps with optional fields and default values

patterns_discovered.description: Uses theme colors and shadows for consistent styling
Default pricing tiers included directly in component file
patterns_discovered.implementation: DEFAULT_PRICING_TIERS constant array with tier configurations

gotchas_discovered.description: Pricing tiers are hardcoded in the component, limiting flexibility for different pricing structures
gotchas_discovered.impact: Would require component modification to change pricing data; not suitable for dynamic pricing from CMS or API

gotchas_discovered.description: Price prop accepts string | number, with conditional rendering of 'per month' text
gotchas_discovered.impact: Type checking relies on typeof check at runtime; Enterprise tier uses 'Custom' string instead of number

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Feature list rendering without unique IDs
gotchas_discovered.description: Features mapped with array index as key instead of unique identifiers
gotchas_discovered.impact: Could cause issues if feature list order changes; not ideal for React reconciliation

gotchas_discovered.gotcha: Button click handler not connected in default section
gotchas_discovered.description: onButtonClick callback is optional and not implemented in PricingSection component
gotchas_discovered.impact: Buttons in default pricing section don't have click handlers; would need to be added when integrating

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully created a comprehensive pricing section component with well-structured Material-UI styling
what_worked: Clean component architecture with separation between PricingCard (reusable) and PricingSection (container)
Effective use of MUI styled components for responsive, theme-aware styling
Featured tier differentiation with visual hierarchy (scale, shadow, border, badge)
Responsive grid layout that adapts from 1 to 3 columns across breakpoints
Proper TypeScript typing with optional props and sensible defaults
approach_outcome.completeness: Core functionality complete; component is ready for basic use cases
approach_outcome.production_readiness: Needs integration work: click handlers, dynamic data source, and accessibility review

recommendations.rationale: Hardcoded DEFAULT_PRICING_TIERS limits reusability; consider accepting tiers as prop or fetching from API
recommendations.suggested_approach: Accept pricingTiers array as optional prop to PricingSection for flexibility

recommendations.rationale: onButtonClick callbacks are defined but not wired in PricingSection; buttons won't be functional
recommendations.suggested_approach: Pass onButtonClick callback for each tier or implement tier-specific handlers

recommendations.recommendation: Use stable keys for feature list
recommendations.rationale: Current index-based keys can cause reconciliation issues if features reorder
recommendations.suggested_approach: Include unique ID in feature objects or use hash of feature text

recommendations.rationale: Component lacks aria labels and semantic structure for screen readers
recommendations.suggested_approach: Add role attributes, aria-labels for featured badge, semantic pricing structure

recommendations.rationale: string | number type with runtime typeof check is fragile
recommendations.suggested_approach: Use discriminated union type: PriceFixed { type: 'fixed'; amount: number } | PriceCustom { type: 'custom' }
